result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (4th) and OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th) and the other charge, OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey J. Bender was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: on any vehicle owned and/or operated by Defendant.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date; with work release and transfer privileges

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
